content: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop
RFSH_good: No. 1 "It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop" - Confucius

content: Quality is not an act, it is a habit
RFSH_good: No. 2 "Quality is not an act, it is a habit" - Aristotle

content: All mankind... being all equal and independent, no one ought to harm another in his life, health, liberty or possessions
RFSH_good: No. 3 "All mankind... being all equal and independent, no one ought to harm another in his life, health, liberty or possessions" - John Locke

content: History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce
RFSH_good: No. 4 "History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce" - Karl Marx

content: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts
RFSH_good: No. 5 "The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts" - Bertrand Russell

content: If you are lonely when you're alone, you are in bad company
RFSH_good: No. 6 "If you are lonely when you're alone, you are in bad company" - Jean-Paul Sartre

content: All men's miseries derive from not being able to sit in a quiet room alone
RFSH_good: No. 7 "All men's miseries derive from not being able to sit in a quiet room alone" - Blaise Pascal

content: There is no greater tyranny than that which is perpetrated under the shield of the law and in the name of justice
RFSH_good: No. 8 "There is no greater tyranny than that which is perpetrated under the shield of the law and in the name of justice" - Montesquieu

content: Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them
RFSH_good: No. 9 "Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them" - David Hume

content: Let come what comes, let go what goes. See what remains
RFSH_good: No. 10 "Let come what comes, let go what goes. See what remains" - Ramana Maharshi
